SourceContext.description: Context for how to use a source in a session.

githubRepoContext.description: Context to use a GitHubRepo in a session.

environmentVariablesEnabled.description: Optional. Enables environment variables in the session. If true, the session will use environment variables configured for this source.

source.description: Required. The name of the source this context is for. To get the list of sources, use the ListSources API. Format: sources/{source}

startingBranch.description: Required. The name of the branch to start the session from.

GitHubRepoContext.description: Context to use a GitHubRepo in a session.

Plan.description: A plan is a sequence of steps that the agent will take to complete the task.

steps.description: Output only. The steps in the plan.

id.description: Output only. ID for this plan; unique within a session.

createTime.description: Output only. Time when the plan was created.

id.description: Output only. The id of the session. This is the same as the "{session}" part of the resource name (e.g., "sessions/{session}").

createTime.description: Output only. The time the session was created.

url.description: Output only. The URL of the session to view the session in the Jules web app.

enumDescriptions: The automation mode is unspecified. Default to no automation.
Whenever a final code patch is generated in the session, automatically create a branch and a pull request for it, if applicable.
automationMode.description: Optional. Input only. The automation mode of the session. If not set, the default automation mode will be used.

requirePlanApproval.description: Optional. Input only. If true, plans the agent generates will require explicit plan approval before the agent starts working. If not set, plans will be auto-approved.

sourceContext.description: Optional. The source to use in this session, with additional context. If not provided, Jules will start from scratch.

updateTime.description: Output only. The time the session was last updated.

name.description: Output only. Identifier. The full resource name (e.g., "sessions/{session}").

outputs.description: Output only. The outputs of the session, if any.

prompt.description: Required. The prompt to start the session with.

enumDescriptions: Deprecated: This state is no longer used. The agent is planning.
The agent is waiting for plan approval.
The agent is waiting for user feedback.
state.description: Output only. The state of the session.

title.description: Optional. If not provided, the system will generate one.

Session.description: A session is a contiguous amount of work within the same context.

title.description: The title of the progress update.

description.description: The description of the progress update.

Artifact.description: An artifact is a single unit of data produced by an activity step.

media.description: A media file was produced (e.g. image, video).

changeSet.description: A change set was produced (e.g. code changes).

activities.description: The activities from the specified session.

nextPageToken.description: A token, which can be sent as `page_token` to retrieve the next page. If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages.

ListActivitiesResponse.description: Response message for the ListActivities RPC.

pullRequest.description: A pull request created by the session, if applicable.

changeSet.description: A change set created by the session, if applicable.

output.description: The bash output. Includes both stdout and stderr.

nextPageToken.description: A token, which can be sent as `page_token` to retrieve the next page. If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages.

sessions.description: The sessions from the specified request.

suggestedCommitMessage.description: A suggested commit message for the patch, if one is generated.

baseCommitId.description: The base commit id of the patch. This is the id of the commit that the patch should be applied to.

SendMessageRequest.description: Request message for the SendMessage RPC.

prompt.description: Required. The user prompt to send to the session.

displayName.description: The name of the GitHub branch.

planId.description: The ID of the plan that was approved.

ChangeSet.description: A set of changes to be applied to a source.

source.description: The name of the source this change set applies to. Format: sources/{source}

id.description: Output only. The id of the source. This is the same as the "{source}" part of the resource name (e.g., "sources/{source}").

Source.description: An input source of data for a session.

description.description: Output only. A description of this activity.

id.description: Output only. The id of the activity. This is the same as the "{activity}" part of the resource name (e.g., "sessions/{session}/activities/{activity}").

originator.description: The entity that this activity originated from (e.g. "user", "agent", "system").

artifacts.description: Output only. The artifacts produced by this activity.

createTime.description: Output only. The time at which this activity was created.

Activity.description: An activity is a single unit of work within a session.

title.description: Output only. The title of the step.

index.description: Output only. 0-based index into the plan.steps.

id.description: Output only. ID for this step; unique within a plan.

description.description: Output only. The description of the step.

Empty.description: A generic empty message that you can re-use to avoid defining duplicated empty messages in your APIs. A typical example is to use it as the request or the response type of an API method. For instance: service Foo { rpc Bar(google.protobuf.Empty) returns (google.protobuf.Empty); }

ApprovePlanRequest.description: Request message for the ApprovePlan RPC.

SendMessageResponse.description: Response message for the SendMessage RPC.

ApprovePlanResponse.description: Response message for the ApprovePlan RPC.

description.description: The description of the pull request.

baseRef.description: The base branch name of the pull request (e.g., "main").

url.description: The URL of the pull request.

title.description: The title of the pull request.

headRef.description: The head branch name of the pull request (e.g., "feature-x").

nextPageToken.description: A token, which can be sent as `page_token` to retrieve the next page. If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages.

sources.description: The sources from the specified request.

ListSourcesResponse.description: Response message for the ListSources RPC.

owner.description: The owner of the repo; the `` in `https://github.com//`.

defaultBranch.description: The default branch for this repo.

branches.description: The list of active branches for this repo.

repo.description: The name of the repo; the `` in `https://github.com//`.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

description: Programmatically create and access your asynchronous coding tasks.

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-pl.description: See, edit, configure, and delete your Google Cloud data and see the email address for your Google Account.

name: jules
title: Jules API

session.description: Required. The resource name of the session to approve the plan in. Format: sessions/{session}

approvePlan.description: Approves a plan in a session.

name.description: Required. The resource name of the session to retrieve. Format: sessions/{session}
Required. The resource name of the session to delete. Format: sessions/{session}

pageSize.description: Optional. The number of sessions to return. Must be between 1 and 100, inclusive. If unset, defaults to 30. If set to greater than 100, it will be coerced to 100.

pageToken.description: Optional. A page token, received from a previous `ListSessions` call.

session.description: Required. The resource name of the session to post the message to. Format: sessions/{session}

sendMessage.description: Sends a message from the user to a session.

pageSize.description: Optional. The number of activities to return. Must be between 1 and 100, inclusive. If unset, defaults to 50. If set to greater than 100, it will be coerced to 100.

parent.description: Required. The parent session, which owns this collection of activities. Format: sessions/{session}

pageToken.description: Optional. A page token, received from a previous `ListActivities` call.

filter.description: Optional. The filter expression for listing activities. If not set, all activities will be returned. Currently only supports filtering by create_time. Invalid filter strings will result in an INVALID_ARGUMENT error. The OR operator has higher precedence than AND. The expression a AND b OR c evaluates to a AND (b OR c). Prefer to use explicit parentheses in complex expressions. Example filters: - 'create_time:*' (matches all activities with create_time set) - 'create_time > "2024-09-04T10:00:00Z"' - 'create_time > "2024-09-04T10:00:00Z" AND create_time < "2024-09-05T10:00:00Z"' - 'create_time < "2024-09-04T10:00:00Z" OR create_time > "2024-09-05T10:00:00Z"'

name.description: Required. The resource name of the activity to retrieve. Format: sessions/{session}/activities/{activity}
Required. The resource name of the source to retrieve. Format: sources/{source}

filter.description: Optional. The filter expression for listing sources, based on AIP-160. If not set, all sources will be returned. Currently only supports filtering by name, which can be used to filter by a single source or multiple sources separated by OR. Example filters: - 'name=sources/source1 OR name=sources/source2'

pageSize.description: Optional. The number of sources to return. Must be between 1 and 100, inclusive. If unset, defaults to 30. If set to greater than 100, it will be coerced to 100.

pageToken.description: Optional. A page token, received from a previous `ListSources` call.
